title: Can an Utterly Blank Wall Be Chic?
text:
YES

IN AN ERA of maximalism, when we celebrate near-baroque layers of color, texture and pattern, leaving a wall completely devoid of decoration is the interior-design equivalent of a double-dog dare. Carla Weisberg, who designs fabrics, wallpapers and rugs as well as interiors, would hardly self-identify as a minimalist. But the New Yorker has risen to the restraint challenge, noting that sometimes going au naturel can balance a décor scheme. After blanketing the walls of an entry from floor to ceiling with items from a client’s collections—including 1950s Argentine pulp-art book covers and vintage signage—she convinced...
description: No art. No wallpaper. Statement-making or sad? Interior designers weigh in on the polarizing topic of the unadorned wall.
